title: Routing
description: Learn how to use FlexiUI with client-side routing libraries.

body.raw:
# Routing FlexiUI works seamlessly with all popular React routing solutions, including Next.js App Router, React Router, and Remix. ## Next.js App Router FlexiUI components are fully compatible with Next.js 13+ App Router: ```tsx import { Button } from '@flexi-ui/button' import { Link } from '@flexi-ui/link' export default function Page() { return (
About
) } ``` ## React Router Use FlexiUI components with React Router: ```tsx import { Link as RouterLink } from 'react-router-dom' import { Button } from '@flexi-ui/button' function App() { return ( ) } ``` ## Remix FlexiUI integrates smoothly with Remix: ```tsx import { Link as RemixLink } from '@remix-run/react' import { Button } from '@flexi-ui/button' export default function Index() { return ( ) } ``` ## Client-Side Navigation All FlexiUI components support the `as` prop, allowing you to use them with any routing library while maintaining their styling and behavior.
